item.title: Something for the Weekend – 31/05/25
item.content:encoded:
https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/05/31/something-for-the-weekend-31-05-25/

Next week is set to be just about the busiest week of the year. More than that, with the Switch 2 launch, Summer Games Fest and even some developers and publishers choosing the back end of next week to launch, it’s going to be the busiest 72-hours in video gamedom.

But before we get to that, let’s look back on the week that was.

In the News This Week

  • GAME has cancelled some Nintendo Switch 2 pre-orders
  • Atomfall’s Wicked Isle story DLC launches on June 3rd
  • Pokémon Legends: Z-A release date confirmed for October
  • Dragon Quest I & II HD-2D Remake gets an October release date
  • Nacon regains the WRC license to make rally racing games from 2027
  • Cyberpunk 2 is now in pre-production, CDPR confirms
  • EA cancels Black Panther game and shuts down developer Cliffhanger Games
  • PlayStation Days of Play 2025 brings discounts on PS5 consoles, accessories & PS Plus
  • The June 2025 PS Plus Monthly Games include Jet Set Radio’s spiritual successor

Games in Review & Featured Articles

OK, so there’s only really one game that anyone’s going to care about this week. How has Elden Ring Nightreign adapted to a more fully-fledged multiplayer style?

  • RoadCraft – PS5, XS|XS, PC – 9/10
  • Pipistrello and the Cursed Yoyo – PS5, PS4, NSW, PC – 9/10
  • F1 25 – PS5, XSX|S, PC – 8/10
  • Elden Ring Nightreign – PS5, XSX|S, PS4, XBO, PC – 7/10
  • Hypercharge Unboxed – PS5, XSX|S, NSW, PC – 5/10
  • Death end re;Quest: Code Z – PS5, PS4, PC – 4/10
  • Scar-Lead Salvation – PS5, PS4, PC – 3/10

And we had a pair of hardware reviews that you probably won’t want to wear out of the house…

  • RIG 900 Max HS Gaming Headset – 9/10
  • Woojer Vest 3 – 9/10

Elsewhere, Tuffcub got to go hands on with one of the most anticipated games of the year, the not-quite-a-Soulslike, waypoint-hating Hell Is Us. He rather liked it!

Nic had some thoughts about Final Fantasy’s crossover conundrum and why nobody can preorder Magic cards. Thankfully he was able to console himself by checking out the Dragon Quest I & II HD-2D Remake. And Dom visited Katowice in Poland, which is turning into a global hub for gaming.

And rounding out the week, What We Played featured F1 25, Hypercharge: Unboxed and Tainted Grail: The Fall of Avalon

Trailer Park

Switch 2 exclusive anti-grav racer Fast Fusion looks exceptional in its launch trailer

Kingmakers blends modern and medieval warfare in Early Access this October

MindsEye gets an explainer trailer, just two weeks before launch

Your Achievements

What have you been playing this week?

  • TSBonyman’s sadly run into a progress breaking bug in Oblivion and doesn’t fancy replaying a whole chunk of the game to rectify it. So he’s hopped into the Skyrim and Elden Ring inspired Tainted Grail… which is also quite buggy, but does at least have active devs working on it.

That’s the round up for this week. Hope you have a great weekend ahead and we’ll see you back here next week!

item.title: Elden Ring Nightreign patch on the way to make it easier for solo players
item.content:encoded:
https://www.thesixthaxis.com/2025/05/30/elden-ring-nightreign-patch/

It’s barely been out a day, but the internet has had its say on Elden Ring Nightreign, and it’s said, “Ooh missus, it’s a bit hard when I’m playing by myself.”

Bandai Namco and FromSoftware are listening and have announced an upcoming patch that will include “improvements for solo expeditions”, specifically that “the effect “Automatic Revival Upon Defeat”, which allows revival once per night boss battle, will be added to solo expeditions.” Additionally, the amount of runes gained will be increased. The Nightreign patch will also include the usual round of bug fixes and improvements,

From Software also revealed that they had sold 2 million copies of the game in a single day.

While good, Elden Ring Nightreign has not gathered the universal acclaim of its predecessor and currently sits on a score of 77 on Metacritic.  We gave the game a solid 7/10 in our review, with Jim saying, “Elden Ring Nightreign is a fun multiplayer offshoot, but it also doesn’t come close to the dizzying heights we’re used to seeing from FromSoftware. It’s an interesting experiment, and I am glad it exists despite my mixed feelings, but it’s a shallow happiness when I expect far more profound experiences from this company.”

Elden Ring Nightreign is available on PS5, PS4, Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, and PC.

Source: Twitter
